titleStmt.title: The last speech and confession of John Thompson, Richard Crook alias Hide, John Atkins alias Lush, Richard Stanley, Robert Wright, and Thomas Birch, for killing the two boys. Who were executed at Tybourn, on Friday the 4th. of this instant May, 1688.
titleStmt.author: Thompson, John, d. 1688.
Crook, Richard, d. 1688.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by George Croom, at the Blue-Ball in Thames-Street, near Baynard's-Castle,

notesStmt.note: Attributed to John Thompson. Cf. Wing (2nd ed.).
Reproduction of original in: Bodleian Library.
